me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.menu.inventory

Class InventoryMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.menu.inventory.InventoryMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CyclingInventoryMenu

    public class InventoryMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements Listener
    Creates an inventory that acts as a menu.
    Author:
    nisovin (original code), Glen Husman

    • Constructor Detail

      • InventoryMenu

        public InventoryMenu(java.lang.String name,
             int size)
        Creates an inventory menu.
        Parameters:
        name - The color formatted name of the menu. This value is assumed to be unique when determining if a clicked inventory was this inventory. This is asserted internally within the class.
        size - The size of the inventory, which must be a multiple of 9.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static InventoryMenu.Builder create(java.lang.String name,
                           int rows)
        Creates an inventory menu builder.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the inventory.
        rows - The number of rows in the inventory.
        Returns:
        The new factory instance.

      • createChest

        public static InventoryMenu.Builder createChest(java.lang.String name)
        Creates an inventory menu the size of a chest (3 rows).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the inventory.
        Returns:
        The new factory instance.

      • createLargeChest

        public static InventoryMenu.Builder createLargeChest(java.lang.String name)
        Creates an inventory menu the size of a large chest (6 rows).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the inventory.
        Returns:
        The new factory instance.

        public void deleteOption(int position)
        Removes the icon at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - The zero-based index of the item.

        Destroys this inventory menu instance.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Gets the number of available option slots in this InventoryMenu instance.
        Returns:
        The number of available option slots in this inventory menu instance. If there is an illegal internal state, this method will return -1.

      • onInventoryClick

        protected void onInventoryClick(InventoryClickEvent event)
        Event handler for inventory clicks.
        Parameters:
        event - The event.

      • show

        public final InventoryView show(Player player)
        Opens this inventory menu for the specified player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player for which to show the inventory.
        Returns:
        The resulting inventory view.

      • open

        public InventoryView open(Player player)
        Opens this inventory menu for the specified player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player for which to show the inventory.
        Returns:
        The resulting inventory view.

      • registerOptionClickHandler

        public void registerOptionClickHandler(OptionClickEvent.Handler handler)
        Register an event handler to be invoked when an option is clicked.
        Parameters:
        handler - An event handler that will be invoked upon option selection.

      • setOption

        public void setOption(int position,
             ItemStack icon)
        Sets the option at the specified position to the specified item.
        Parameters:
        position - The zero-based index of the item.
        icon - The item itself to use.

      • setOption

        public void setOption(int position,
             ItemStack icon,
             java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String... info)
        Sets the option at the specified position to the specified item. The item will have the specified name and lore.
        Parameters:
        position - The zero-based index of the item.
        icon - The item itself to use.
        name - The color-formatted name of the item.
        info - The color-formatted lore of the item.
